column4: Hello, what drivers do I need to load  Intel Corporation PRO/Wireless 3945ABG wireless driver?
iwl3945
on hardy, ipw3945 on gutsy and older
iwl3945 is included in the installation, one thing u might wanna do is install backports package
it has an updated intel driver
its not in any of the packages this driver is opensource and include in the kernel
the driver is relatively new and unstable, many people report issues with it, try backports package
still can't se it in the repo... even did a search for 3945
sudo apt-get install linux-backports-modules-hardy
Ok the driver is loaded but I can't connect to any wireless network
do u see any networks at all?
yes I see them
even tried creating my own
hm... when u try to connect to one of those, immediately after it fails run dmesg and pastebin its output
one more time... ican't get net access right now but in my message log all I see is this: ADDRCONF(NETDEV_UP): wlan0: link is not ready
as I was saying... "ADDRCONF(NETDEV_UP): wlan0: link is not ready" is the message I see
thats not enough...arrg. ok do sudo apt-get install build-essential linux-headers
then head on to http://wireless.kernel.org/en/users/Download
and follow the instructions on that site
oh ok no problem
see the thing is gutsy used proprietary ipw3945 driver which was pretty good but it was closed hardy decided that opensource iwl3945 was ready when apparently it wasnt
pissed me off to but it was still a right decision u'll get better support for OSS driver on the long run
